announcements.title: The Cathedral will resume regular Mass Schedule as of February 16th, 2021. Mass times below.
announcements.descriptive:
Due to Covid-19, we will be resuming our previous Mass Schedule at 30% capacity.
Our schedule will continue to be updated.

Parishioners are asked to review
[Worship Safe in Pictures and Points](http://peterboroughdiocese.org/en/resourcesGe…).

The televised Sunday Mass will continue on YouTube.
Check [Special events](#schedule2) below for information and links.

announcements.title: Join our mailing list
announcements.descriptive:
Be the first to know!
Stay in the loop with everything going on at The Cathedral.

Sign up to receive regular updates, announcements, links to bulletins, and more,
delivered straight to your inbox!

Let's stay connected.

[Sign up...](https://mailchi.mp/ac8e8cadb5e8/dont-miss-out)

announcements.title: Daily Lenten Reflection
announcements.subtitle: March 12, 2021
announcements.descriptive:
Hold Nothing Back. Reflect, today, upon the beautiful commandment of our Lord.

It is a command of love, and it is given to us not so much for God’s sake but for ours. God wants to fill us to the point of overflowing love. Why would we ever choose anything less?

Let us Pray… My loving Lord, Your love for me is infinite and perfect in every way.  I pray that I will learn to love You with every fiber of my being, holding nothing back, and to daily grow deeper in my love of You.

As I grow in that love, I thank You for the overflowing nature of that love, and I pray that this love of You will flow into the hearts of those around me. - Fr. Joshy George

announcements.title: St. Joseph Novena
announcements.subtitle: March 12, 2021 - Day 3
announcements.descriptive:
Today is the third day of a 9 day Novena.

Join us in praying the
[Novena to St. Joseph](https://www.peterboroughdiocese.org/en/life-and-faith/year-of-st--joseph.aspx).
